intro: Tetranthera acuminatissima, commonly known as the narrow-pointed tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth.
